resources.title: Getting Started with KongAir APIs
resources.description: A comprehensive guide to get started with KongAir APIs
resources.content:
# Getting Started with KongAir APIs

Welcome to the KongAir Developer Portal! This guide will help you get started with our APIs.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin, make sure you have:

- A valid API key
- Basic understanding of REST APIs
- Your favorite HTTP client (curl, Postman, etc.)

## Quick Start

1. **Obtain an API Key**: Register for an account to get your API key
2. **Explore APIs**: Browse our available APIs in the portal
3. **Make your first request**: Use the interactive documentation to test API calls

## Authentication

All API requests require authentication using an API key. Include your key in the request header:

```bash
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" https://api.kongair.example.com/v1/users
```

## Rate Limiting

Our APIs implement rate limiting to ensure fair usage:

- **Free tier**: 1000 requests per hour
- **Premium tier**: 10000 requests per hour

## Support

If you need help:

- Check our [FAQ](/faq)
- Visit our [Documentation](/docs)
- Contact support at api-support@kongair.com

Happy coding! ðŸš€

resources.content:
# Frequently Asked Questions

## General Questions

### What is the kongair API?

The kongair API is a comprehensive set of REST APIs that provide access to our digital banking services, user management, and transaction processing capabilities.

### How do I get started?

1. Register for a developer account
2. Obtain your API credentials
3. Review our [Getting Started](/getting-started) guide
4. Start building!

## Authentication

### How do I authenticate my requests?

All API requests require an API key passed in the Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
```

### What happens if my API key expires?

API keys are valid for 1 year. You'll receive email notifications 30 days before expiration.

## Rate Limiting

### What are the rate limits?

- Free tier: 1000 requests/hour
- Premium tier: 10000 requests/hour
- Enterprise: Custom limits available

### What happens when I exceed the rate limit?

You'll receive a 429 HTTP status code. Wait before making additional requests.

## Support

### How can I get help?

- Email: api-support@kongair.com
- Documentation: Available in this portal
- Status page: https://status.kongair.com

### Do you offer SLA guarantees?

Yes, our Enterprise tier includes 99.9% uptime SLA with 24/7 support.

resources.title: Rate Limiting with Retry Logic
resources.description: Example showing how to handle rate limits with exponential backoff
resources.content:
```bash
#!/bin/bash

# kongair API Rate Limiting Example with Retry Logic

API_KEY="your-api-key-here"
BASE_URL="https://api.kongair.example.com/v1"
MAX_RETRIES=3
INITIAL_DELAY=1

# Function to make API request with retry logic
make_api_request() {
    local endpoint="$1"
    local method="${2:-GET}"
    local data="$3"
    local retry_count=0
    local delay=$INITIAL_DELAY
    
    while [ $retry_count -lt $MAX_RETRIES ]; do
        echo "Attempt $((retry_count + 1)) for $endpoint"
        
        # Make the API request
        if [ "$method" = "GET" ]; then
            response=$(curl -s -w "\n%{http_code}" \
                -H "Authorization: Bearer $API_KEY" \
                -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
                "$BASE_URL$endpoint")
        else
            response=$(curl -s -w "\n%{http_code}" \
                -X "$method" \
                -H "Authorization: Bearer $API_KEY" \
                -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
                -d "$data" \
                "$BASE_URL$endpoint")
        fi
        
        # Extract HTTP status code (last line) and response body
        http_code=$(echo "$response" | tail -n1)
        response_body=$(echo "$response" | head -n -1)
        
        case $http_code in
            200|201|204)
                echo "Success: $response_body"
                return 0
                ;;
            429)
                echo "Rate limit exceeded. Waiting ${delay}s before retry..."
                sleep $delay
                delay=$((delay * 2))  # Exponential backoff
                retry_count=$((retry_count + 1))
                ;;
            401)
                echo "Error: Unauthorized. Please check your API key."
                return 1
                ;;
            403)
                echo "Error: Forbidden. Insufficient permissions."
                return 1
                ;;
            404)
                echo "Error: Resource not found."
                return 1
                ;;
            *)
                echo "Error: HTTP $http_code - $response_body"
                return 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    echo "Failed after $MAX_RETRIES attempts"
    return 1
}

# Example usage
echo "Fetching users..."
make_api_request "/users"

echo "\nCreating a new user..."
user_data='{"name": "John Doe", "email": "john.doe@example.com"}'
make_api_request "/users" "POST" "$user_data"
```
